intro: Camchaya bolavenensis, commonly known as the Bolaven camchaya, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in montane forests. Its leaves are dark green and glossy, with a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Camchaya bolavenensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
